title: Will Huawei be involved in building UK's 5G network?
text:
Huawei's 5G boss has encouraged Boris Johnson to set aside the fact it is Chinese when deciding whether to allow the company to run parts of Britain's wireless networks.

The telecoms giant, which is the world's leading 5G equipment maker, has been banned from operating in the US amid concerns its technology could be accessed by the Chinese state.

Huawei denies this would be possible and Germany last week gave the company the green light to operate there.

Downing Street is poised to make its own decision on Huawei's involvement in building the UK's 5G network.

Speaking at Huawei's Mobile Broadband Forum in Zurich, Chaobin Yang said it was possible to fix technical flaws in Huawei's equipment, but added that the firm could do no more to prove its technology is secure.

He said taking a decision on supplier should not be based on which country a company is from.
